question: Which country is to set up its new Research base ‘Comandante Ferraz Antarctic Station’ in Antarctica?
explanation:
Brazil recently announced that it would officially open its new research base in Antarctica this week. The original research base of Brazil in Antarctica was destroyed by a fire in 2012. The construction of the new base started in 2015 and it involves a project cost of near $ 100 million.
The station has seventeen laboratories which will support research in several fields. It also possesses a state-of-the-art infrastructure and accommodation facilities for more than 60 people. The new base is on the same place of the previous one and bears the same name of Comandante Ferraz Antarctic Station.
